head.title: A Haunted House and Pumpkin-Eating Bears

meta.content: PLAYING IN THE NEIGHBORHOOD: NEW YORK ZOOS
meta.name: column_name

series.series.name: PLAYING IN THE NEIGHBORHOOD: NEW YORK ZOOS

hedline.hl1: A Haunted House and Pumpkin-Eating Bears

abstract.p: Halloween will be marked at New York zoos in various ways; photo (S)

block.p: HALLOWEEN is creeping into zoos in Manhattan, Brooklyn and Queens with activities for children and adults Saturday and next Sunday.

At the Central Park Zoo, Gus, Ida and Lily the polar bears will have pumpkin on their menu, with feedings at noon and 2:30 P.M. A witch will introduce a tarantula to those who dare meet this hairy arachnid, and inside the zoo's bat cave there will be an chance to look at their upside-down world.
HALLOWEEN is creeping into zoos in Manhattan, Brooklyn and Queens with activities for children and adults Saturday and next Sunday.

At the Central Park Zoo, Gus, Ida and Lily the polar bears will have pumpkin on their menu, with feedings at noon and 2:30 P.M. A witch will introduce a tarantula to those who dare meet this hairy arachnid, and inside the zoo's bat cave there will be an chance to look at their upside-down world.
At the Prospect Park Zoo, the baboons will also eat a special meal, and the truth about snakes and spiders will be told as part of a live presentation at 1:30 and 3:30 each day.

At the Queens Zoo, children are invited both days to help turn the education building, an old barn, into a haunted house by helping to paint a scary mural. There will be also be frightening stories told about wildlife, and face painting.

Central Park Zoo, Fifth Avenue and 64th Street, (212) 861-6030; Prospect Park Zoo, 450 Flatbush Avenue near Empire Boulevard, (718) 399-7339; Queens Zoo, 53-51 111th Street in Flushing Meadows Corona Park, (718) 271-1500; hours for all zoos, 10 A.M. to 4:30 P.M. daily; admission for all, $2.50 for adults, $1.25 for 65 and over, 50 cents for children 3 to 12, 3 and under free.
PLAYING IN THE NEIGHBORHOOD: NEW YORK ZOOS
